subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 19, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIES9 Firefighters Killed In Charleston Blaze
Nine firefighters died in a blaze that swept through a furniture warehouse, the mayor of Charleston, S.C., said. Witnesses
                        said the store's roof collapsed, throwing debris over about two-dozen rescue workers. Onlookers were hit with flying ash. More...Watch: 9 Firefighters Killed In Blaze
• Iraqi Orphanage Nightmare
                     					| Watch• Iraq Blast Kills 61; U.S. Hunts Al Qaeda
                     					| Watch• Missing Mom's Son: "Mommy's In The Rug"
                     					| WatchU.S.At Least 5 Dead, 5 Missing In Texas Floods
Torrential rains, as much as an inch every 15 minutes at one point, swept away mobile homes, cars, and people. A 5-year-old
                        girl and her grandmother were killed, and the girl's 2-year-old sister is missing. Another 4-year-old also died. More...Watch: Flash Floods Kill 5
• 9 Firefighters Killed In Charleston Blaze
                     					| Watch• Boy Killed By Black Bear In Utah• Missing Mom's Son: "Mommy's In The Rug"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldIraqi Orphanage Nightmare
It was a shocking scene for U.S. soldiers to come across: barely alive young bodies strewn around a Baghdad orphanage. CBS
                        News has obtained exclusive photographs of the scene, and Lara Logan spoke with some troops who were there. More...Watch: Orphans Left To Starve In Iraq
• Iraq Blast Kills 61; U.S. Hunts Al Qaeda
                     					| Watch• Cuba's "First Lady" Dead At 77• Taliban Fighting Hard In South Afghanistan
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsPanel: Missing RNC E-Mails May Violate Law
The Bush administration may have committed "extensive" violations of a law requiring that certain records be preserved, said
                        the House Oversight Committee's chairman, adding the panel will deepen its probe into the use of political e-mail accounts. More...
• White House Conference Center Evacuated• Judge Orders Duke DA To Leave Duties• Antitrust Ruling Goes Against Investors• More StoriesHealthSplitting Pills May Help Medication Costs
Splitting high-dose prescription tablets in half can provide relief from high drug costs without affecting health adversely,
                        a University of Michigan study suggests. More...
• Soy Compound May Bolster Women's Bones• Steep Drop In Death Among Diabetic Men• 111-Year-Old Cited As World's Oldest Man• More StoriesSciTechOil Industry Scales Back Expansion Plans 
A push from Congress and the White House for huge increases in biofuels, such as ethanol, is prompting the oil industry to
                        scale back its plans for refinery expansions. That could keep gasoline prices high, possibly for years to come. More...
• Space Station's Computers Seem A-OK• Wireless Technology Takes A Leap Forward• Global Pedophile Ring Busted
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessBoeing Gets A Wing Up On The Competition
With better fuel efficiency and a roomier interior, the 787 "Dreamliner" is giving Boeing a wing up on the competition. Nancy
                        Cordes reports on how the 787 could catapult Boeing past archrival Airbus for the foreseeable future. More...Watch: Boeing's 'Dreamliner'
• Yahoo's Terry Semel Steps Down As CEO• Former Enron Broadband Exec Sentenced• Dubai Company Buys QE2 Ocean Liner • More StoriesEntertainmentMichael Jackson Settles $48M Lawsuit
Lawyers for Michael Jackson have settled a lawsuit brought by a New Jersey financial company that was seeking $48 million. More...Watch: Jackson Cleared Of Abuse
• Julia Roberts Welcomes A Son• Gandolfini Goes From "Soprano" To Iraq• Columnist Claudia Cohen Dead At 56• More StoriesOpinionFatah's Fall
The New Republic says that with the rise of Hamas in Gaza, the Bush administration must alter its tactics and make
                        a more concerted effort for peace in the Middle East.  More...Watch: Escaping Hamas-Ruled Gaza
• Lieberman Takes Heat For Iran Warnings
                     					| Watch• Andy's Personality Quiz
                     					| Watch• Maybe There Should Be A Third Party
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Health: New Web Site Rates Hundreds Of Sunscreens
The Environmental Working Group tells how well they ward off various harmful rays. The EWG's research head explained, on The
                        Early Show. More...

Iraq's Hidden ShameU.S. troops were shocked to discover more than 20 starving children at a government-run orphanage in Baghdad. Lara Logan reports.
